p: L. borgpetersenii and L. interrogans infection were then investigated separately, which once again showed that locality, habitat and sex, but not rodent species, were the major determinants of infection ( Figure 3 and Text S1). This last analysis suggested a difference in ecological niche for both Leptospira species. In particular, L. borgpetersenii was much more abundant in dry habitats (non-floodable lands) than L. interrogans.
